DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indication of whether a lesion or lymph node is measurable or non-measurable.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation.  Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia.  Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Capable of being measured.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/31/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 6/19/16 changed context back to NCIP, changed in error by SBR on 6/6/16 to NHLBI; released.  jk  3/20/15 created per Rnd 5 community comments and RECISTv1.1, sec 3.1. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.14 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002731. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/31/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 6/19/16 removed qualifer concept; released. jk 3/20/15 created per Rnd 5 community comments (RECIST 3.1); replaces VD 2017028. jc

ReferenceDocuments.name: RECISTv1.1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Special considerations regarding lesion measurability of bone lesions, cystic lesions, and lesions previously treated with local therapy require particular comment as desribed in section 3.1.3 of the RECIST guidelines.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Measurable
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specific criteria for measurable tumor lesions and malignant lymph nodes are provided in section 3.1.1. of the RECISTv1.1 guidelines.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Non-measurable
ReferenceDocuments.description: Specific criteria for non-measurable lesions are provided in section 3.1.2. of the RECISTv1.1 guidelines

ReferenceDocuments.name: irRECIST
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measurable lesions must be accurately measured in at least one dimension with a minimum size of: 10 mm in the longest diameter by CT or MRI scan (or no less than double the slice thickness) for nonnodal lesions and ≥15 mm in short axis for nodal lesions OR 10 mm caliper measurement by clinical exam OR 20 mm by chest X-ray.

DataElement.origin: RECISTv1.1:Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors v1.1
DataElement.changeDescription: 11/20/17 jk add irRECIST reference and description of measurable tumor.  8/31/17 tt transferred context, changed registration status per Round 5 finalization task. 6/19/16 released. jk  5/7/15 corrected pref question typo. jc 3/20/15 created per Rnd 5 community comments and RECISTv1.1, sec 3.1; meas/non-meas values only.
